website_summaries.verdict: Full-size handcrafted classical guitar made from quality mahogany and Canadian cedar top, with well-built hardware. A lightweight but solid build.
pros: The top is constructed from Canadian cedar with solid mahogany back and sides
The rosewood fingerboard offers a smooth action
Nice finishing touch with the hand inlaid wooden rosette around the sound hole
cons: A small number of users report minor imperfections with the finish of the guitar they received

customer_reviews.title: I'm a beginner player and I wanted a good sounding guitar and yet I didn't want to play ...
customer_reviews.text: My classically trained teacher (undergraduate and Masters degrees) thought that this guitar was fabulous for what it is and guessed it to have cost me in the area of $400 in price. I'm a beginner player and I wanted a good sounding guitar and yet I didn't want to play on an instrument that would be a discouragement. I'm sold on Cordoba and will be buying a higher priced/quality one for my next guitar. If you can afford more money than I would buy the next few steps up than this one, but it is a great guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Classical Guitar

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value for the money. I have paid much more for lesser-sounding guitars. It arrived in perfect condition. Not the slightest imperfection anywhere. It's easy to hold, easy to play (even with my very old fingers), and sounds great. I'm very pleased with the low-gloss finish on this model. The colors of the wood are darker than they appear in the photo's, but it's still a beauty. No surprise, new guitar strings stretch. Clip on your Snark and give it a tune before playing. It's quick and easy to do. Although it sounds like it, I have no connection with Cordoba other than now owning one of their guitars.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasEarle

customer_reviews.title: Enchanting
customer_reviews.text: I received this wonderful guitar just yesterday, and I already love it. It sounds amazing--enchanting, even. The only thing that comes close to con is it seems to go slightly out of tune much more quickly than my electric guitar, so I have to tune it a lot, but I suppose that gives me even more practice since I am only a beginner still learning the ways of the guitar. The soft feel to the nylon strings are very different from my electric guitar's steel strings, but I am getting used to it. So far, I am happy with this guitar and love the sound that it produces.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed with this guitar
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. For the money I'm impressed. The fit and finish is excellent. I really like the matte finish that doesn't show every fingerprint. The sound is warm and the sustain is long. After acclimation, and a few tunings its starting to hold tune. The neck is straight, the frets are level and are dressed nicely at the fret ends. The tuners feel very smooth and tuning is easy. The action is more than acceptable to me, no buzzing issues, clean warm sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepherder

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar ruined by shoddy quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The frets were not sanded down, meaning that as I slide up and down the neck i'm going to shred my fingers. I really like everything else about this guitar. I'm going to try and see if a local repair shop can fix this but if they can't then I'll have to return it, which would be a shame. So one star for now.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin60

customer_reviews.title: Nice Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. I’m a beginner with classical guitar so it was a great price to see whether it’s something I’ll continue to pursue. The quality of the guitar is well worth the price. Warm tone and good construction. Frets are a bit rough but can be easily filed by a luthier and again, not an issue. Happy with the decision to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar...great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guitar for the money. The setup is very good ( I will be sanding the saddle in the bridge to lower the upper register action) and it has very good residence. As a guitar builder I was curious to see how this company could put together a product of this quality at this price? They certainly did a good job....well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Over delivers for tone and quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not new to playing the guitar and have a very nice high-end acoustic guitar but was interested in exploring playing a totally different style of music. (Spanish/Classical music) Not knowing if this is something I would stick with over time, I wanted to minimize the purchase price without buying something I couldn't stand playing because of tone and quality. I'm EXTREMELY pleased with the purchase of the Cordoba C3M Guitar and is far better than I could have hoped for at this price!
customer_reviews.author: DJ Pallett

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Two strings have terrible buzz out of the box. Also very disappointed in sound on lower strings, Have cheaper guitars that sound better. Being returned to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Laurence A. Canter

customer_reviews.title: Go team Córdoba!
customer_reviews.text: Got the guitar today, and I am very happy with my decision. The guitar is well made, has wonderful resonance, and intonation is spot on. I'm a professional orchestral musician and I purchased this to learn how to play classical guitar as a hobby, and maybe eventually perform on in public when I'm further along. I'm very happy with my decision and to be apart of team Córdoba! Now to practice hard and upgrade to the Rodriguez. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Starting guitar again after 35 years. I have heard good things about the Cordoba guitars and how well they are made. Mine arrived quickly, double boxed and in perfect condition. I am very happy with the finish and build quality. Now I have to start using it!
customer_reviews.author: John J Hannon

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: The guitar had a big indention on the face from a tie down that was overtightened during shipping, and the one I got must have been at the top of the shipment. Otherwise it sounds good and suits my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Frank O.

customer_reviews.title: self destructed after about 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: Decent guitar - until it simply feel apart- see the photo. The guitar was tuned normally, house air-conditioned, and the guitar was not in the sun. But one afternoon the bridge simply pulled loose from the body of the guitar. Made an odd noise. Hard to recommend this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Niels W.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, much lighter than my old acoustic one
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, much lighter than my old acoustic one. However, it does not stay tune for long. Some say that in the first month, the nylon string tends to stretch leading to this phenomena. It's been 4 months already but this still does not hold tune. May be because the temperature varies widely? Last week it was like -10 to 0 C. This week it is 0 to 10 C.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Ewel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: To give some context, I've been playing guitar for over 10 years and consider myself an aspiring fingerstyle guitarist (on a casual level). I got this guitar because of the glowing reviews and now owning it as well as playing it for 5-6 months, gives me better perspective to review this product. For the price, this classical guitar produces phenomenal sound. I've played other classical guitars before at my local Guitar Center and this one is comparable to other more pricier classical guitars in terms of sound. The sound gets better as you play more so I think the wood ages well with time. Overall, for the price, this is a great guitar that you can purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A and J Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner guitar - expect darker less yellowy color than the photos
customer_reviews.text: For my first guitar, it was great. I'd seen other Cordoba models in person, but this is the one I wanted & was fine with ordering it online. I knew from reading other reviews to expect a slightly different coloration from what it may seem from the photos, but since that wasn't going to affect the sound, I didn't care. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Angie N.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas. I am disappointed with the finish, because for the price it seems like it should have been much nicer quality. It's cheap looking. But it's a good "beginners" guitar. It does have a very nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Glorious guitar!!
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is glorious! The craftsmanship on it is superb and the sounds are majestic! Ive been playing it for 3 days non stop and already feel this special bond with my Cordoba C3M. The guitar arrived before scheduled time and in perfect condition and I held close to me staring at the fresh fretboard just imagining all the tunes that can and will be played in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Torres

customer_reviews.title: Does not tune perfectly at the high frets
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for me. I am not a professional musician. It does not tune perfectly at the high frets. Not noticeable to most, but it's slightly off.
customer_reviews.author: mario u.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound and soft strings. With this guitar it was easy to make complicated chords, and helped me as a beginner. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kearison

customer_reviews.title: "Big" guitar isn't big
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands so I bought a big guitar--this one!--46 inches!!!!......What showed up was a 40-incher, just like my current classical guitar. 6 inches must've fallen off in the mail lol. Big Handed Man says Booooo!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Strand

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Good starter/backup guitar. Don't expect the tone of a more expensive model but price is right for what you get. Satin finish takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: hr

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar, until the bridge snapped right off 6 months in.
customer_reviews.text: I take a great deal of care with my guitars, always store them in a case, never hang them from anywhere, no rough treatment. However one day I get back to my room and take out the guitar, and the bridge is snapped clean from the rest of the guitar body. I'll contact support because it seems like I may have just gotten a defective piece, so hopefully that goes well.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Córdoba for sure...
customer_reviews.text: I just love it. It took about a week to get it to settle the strings in after that it pretty well stays in tune. Great sound, well made.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but won't stay in tune.
customer_reviews.text: Been years since I had a classical guitar. It's really pretty and sounds nice, but it will absolutely not stay in tune. My other two guitars sitting on stands in a controlled environ right next to it do. Have had it for at least a month and still a problem staying tune. Maybe it's me as I don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Small defect on body.
customer_reviews.text: Good price. But should have bought the 50 dollar less from amazon warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Sheik

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar...Stays in tune
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great guitar. Play it all the time. Stays in tune very well. I haven't had a nylon string guitar ever but this is very nice to play and sounds very nice. Can do old school Beatles, unplugged Nrivana and Neil Young and stuff like that. Working on two Jack Johnson songs. But it you like it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Solid value.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with this guitar. Well made, nice sound. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn G in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Light weight. Love the matte finish. Play it everyday. Take it everywhere. Only thing I don’t like is one of the strings was broken upon arrival but Cordoba customer service never responded to my calls.
customer_reviews.author: Wai Seto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks and sounds great, nice details and will buy it again
customer_reviews.author: M C Rod

customer_reviews.title: She is very pleased with the sound quality and said that the fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar as a step up from my daughter's beginner guitar. She is very pleased with the sound quality and said that the fit for her was just perfect. From an purely visual prospective, it is made from a very even grained wood, and is a beautiful piece of art.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: It looks and feels amazing. The sound is just awesome. Would definetly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cesar L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat the exquisite classical sound from this guitar. At first I was skeptical given the cost, but convinced this was a deal once it was tuned up and I started to play. The neck is a bit wide as you would expect, but the nylon strings lay down easy. Great guitar!!
customer_reviews.author: pa_eagle

customer_reviews.title: Great classical guitar.
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing this guitar every day since I got it. Good cratsmanship , good tone quality , and nice color. Overall is a four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Well pleased
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for an entry level guitar! Recommend by a guitar teacher as the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This guitar is well constructed, beautiful, and it sounds unbelievable. My son began lessons at 6 years old and his last guitar was a Cordoba (true) 3/4 size. Since he's advancing rather nicely, we got him this 4/4 Cordoba for his 10th birthday. It has a solid top, the size of the body is slightly smaller than my daughter's Yamaha, and when you play a base note, it really continues resonating! Oh, and two day shipping with Amazon Prime. I'm friends with a classical guitarist who asked what kind of guitar we bought. His next question was, "C3M"? "Those are GREAT guitars". So there you have it, two reviews in one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got this guitar today and am pleased with the beautiful music it makes when playing it
customer_reviews.text: I got this guitar today and am pleased with the beautiful music it makes when playing it. Great sound. It is a delicate instrument and I recommend a case.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Terrible buzzzzzzz!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this guitar just as a fun guitar, but honestly expected a bit more due to it's construction materials and makers reputation. I own a $80.00 no-name quarter size classical made of plywood which sounds worlds better. I tried to return the guitar, but the postage is not paid and it cost 53.00 to mail it's large size box back in a timely fashion. My guitar may be a lemon... In my experience Cordoba Guitars are really sweet (fun) to play and sound even better. Lesson in all this is; I will not be buying any guitars over the internet anymore regardless of the manufactures reputation. This was a valuable learning lesson for me and my wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar and another at the same time. The Cordoba C3M is a far more superior guitar. It has a full 1/4 inch deeper depth and gives a beautiful resonance! I highly recommend the Cordoba.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Cross

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Guitar For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is loud, the tone is rich and there are no burrs. I'm fully satisfied so far. A good deal at this price.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: better than the C7 which is 500 bucks
customer_reviews.text: better than the C7 which is 500 bucks. im amazed at the quality. very please with the sound. great value.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Nice tone, holds a tune well and easy on ...
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't picked up a 6-string in decades, but decided to try this for plunkin' around. Nice tone, holds a tune well and easy on the fingers - fit my needs perfectly for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Kansy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Guitar just what i expected will recommend to family and friends. buy it you will not be dissapointed delivery was great came 4 days earlier I am so excited
customer_reviews.author: ngye

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st Guitar
customer_reviews.text: This was my first ever guitar purchase and I couldn't be happier. I was able to pick up the Cordoba C3M and begin learning some basic chords. The guitar sounds amazing and I am confident this is a lot of guitar for me to grow into. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar for my son who just started learning guitar last year.
customer_reviews.text: Nice guitar for my son who just started learning guitar last year. it has a decent sound it looks and feels nice the piece shipped promptly
customer_reviews.author: Nick. A

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas. It is a tremendous guitar for a steal! If you want to play Spanish classical finger style buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Morris

customer_reviews.title: The voice is nice
customer_reviews.text: This is the first nylon guitar. Generally I love it. I know little about classical guitar before, so just in the view of an outsider, I love it. I don't know if I should buy a hard case to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Perfect is all I can say
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son in New Orleans. He was beside himself when he opened the container. It was more than a surprise. He is a part time musician,and mentioned he was wanting to learn Spanish style guitar. Perfect is all I can say. And my son is elated. "a beautiful guitar"
customer_reviews.author: T. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and look. Nice addition to the other typical guitars I own.
customer_reviews.text: Love guitar sound and look. Enjoying making songs my own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great and sounds wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have had this guitar for 10 months and have had no problems with it. The quality is great and sounds wonderful. A great guitar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great just a little fragile I give it 41/2 stars. Get the case you will be glad you did
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Hibbard

customer_reviews.title: ... for a friend and he told me he was happy with the
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend and he told me he was happy with the guitar
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a beginner guitar,  and play it always.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Cordoba to save money and get a good classical guitar to learn how to play, my other acoustics are collecting dust now (at least for a few weeks) while I play this light, aesthetic, and beautiful sounding guitar. Ordered a different new guitar from amazon and it was in used condition so I looked really hard at this guitar and discovered finish imperfections that look like finger prints or popped bubbles in the matte finish at the neck joint. I will never buy a guitar online again. Plays really good and I like this guitar very much.
customer_reviews.author: ranDharma

customer_reviews.title: The guitar gives the for its monie. Had some ...
customer_reviews.text: The guitar gives the for its monie. Had some concerned prior to purchase it. Upon arrival, all expextation were met by the size, looks, quality construction and fidelity on the sound. VR. Luis P.S. still eaiting for the music book we ordered on that same purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and sounds the same
customer_reviews.text: Love this guitar. Wish I were better at playing it.
customer_reviews.author: Otis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully sounding, clear tone. Easy to play. Sounds as good as a professional , more costly guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Santarisieri

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: Do....not....buy.....from TORNAVOZ MUSIC COMPANY. I purchased the guitar used and the description was very good. I can't say that I can rate the guitar all that much just because I don't believe it was sold in "very good" condition. They didn't send me the saddle and when they did it came broken. To top it off the nut wasn't even on. I HAD TO GLUE IT ON! Per the guitar though....it seems good enough for me. I would recommend in the buck fifty range maybe 2 because of the truss rod (love the truss rod). Buy it if you can find it 2 or less.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Cordoba gutar
customer_reviews.text: The guitar is not made for small hands and when I spoke with Cordoba and told them I was going to use it to teach people how to play they said it would be ok. Not so, neck is to big I can play it ok but would rather have a nylon with a thiner neck. I wouldn't recomend this to anyone with small hands and you have to keep the Humdity at 55%, here in East Texas in the summer with the air conditioner running at 72 degrees the humidity is 70% in the house. Now I'm told to buy a humidifier to put in the case to keep it dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good starter Nylon guitar. Pretty good quality being a beginner guitar
customer_reviews.author: danmo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guitar
customer_reviews.text: After 45 years, I have started to learn the guitar again. I am a beginner and have heard good things about the Cordoba and Yamaha guitars. After looking and listening, I decided on Cordoba. I am impressed as to how well they are made. Mine arrived quickly, double boxed and in perfect condition. I am very happy with the finish and build quality. I have tuned it and played a little. It has a great sound. I am happy with my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Payne

product_meta.title: Cordoba C3M Classical Guitar
product_meta.description: Style:Only GuitarOne of the most popular models and a staple in the Iberia Series lineup, the C3M is a full-sized, handcrafted guitar. It is built with the traditional Spanish fan bracing, a solid cedar top and mahogany back and sides. The C3M also has a hand inlaid wooden rosette, a rosewood fingerboard, and gold tuning machines with pearl buttons. The "M" in the title stands for its light matte finish.
feature_bullets: All natural wood, hand inlaid rosette
Natural matte/satin finish allows resonance and sustain

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars155 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
